alert.note: Alert for Gallia (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 1:49AM EST until January 04 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Gallia, Lawrence and Meigs. In West Virginia, Cabell, Mason and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 AM EST, County dispatch centers reported flooding in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Rio Grande, Chesapeake, Rutland, Lake Vesuvius, Kenova, Ceredo, Buffalo, Mason, South Point, Russell, Vernon, Waterloo and Middleport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
